content: {{productName}} owner has been successfully changed. You will be redirected in 10 seconds.

comment.text: This translation key is used for a success message that informs users when they have successfully changed an owner in the portal. The message displays the name of the product being referenced and appears after a successful operation in a UI confirmation dialog.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The passive voice construction "werden umgeleitet werden" is awkward and grammatically incorrect. It should be active.
The sentence structure is a bit clunky. It could be improved for better readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Der {{productName}}-Besitzer wurde erfolgreich geändert. Sie werden in 10 Sekunden umgeleitet.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Spanish translation includes 'Dentro de 10 segundos será redirigido.' which is slightly less natural than alternatives. A more common phrasing would be 'Será redirigido en 10 segundos.'
The phrase "uudelleen ohjataan" (redirected again) is not the most natural way to express redirection. A more standard translation would be "ohjataan" or "siirretään".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: {{productName}} omistajan vaihto onnistui. 10 sekunnin kuluttua sinut ohjataan.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "տնօրինողը փոխվել է" (tnorinorə poxvel e) translates more accurately to 'the owner has been changed' rather than 'the ownership has been changed'. While the difference is subtle, using 'փոխվել է' implies a change in person, which is more appropriate for this context.

The phrase "ຮັບການປ່ຽນເສັ້ນທາງ" is an awkward translation of "redirected". It literally means "receive the change of route". A more natural translation would be something along the lines of "ຈະຖືກນຳທາງໄປ" or "ຈະຖືກສົ່ງໄປ".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ປ່ຽນເຈົ້າຂອງ {{productName}} ສຳເລັດ. ໃນ 10 ວິນາທີທ່ານຈະຖືກນຳທາງໄປ.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Em 10 segundos você será redirecionado' is slightly less natural than alternatives. While grammatically correct, a more idiomatic phrasing would improve fluency.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Em 10 segundos você será redirecionado automaticamente.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Власник {{productName}}-а" is not the most natural way to say '{{productName}} owner' in Serbian. A more common and fluent phrasing would be something like 'Нови власник {{productName}}-а' or '{{productName}}-а сада има новог власника'.
While technically correct, using a hyphenated form of the product name might sound unnatural in certain contexts.  It depends on the specific product.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider if hyphenating the product name is necessary.  It might be better to use the full name without a hyphen if appropriate.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation uses a hyphen to connect 'productName' to its possessive adjective. While not strictly incorrect, it's more common to use a genitive case marker in Serbian (e.g., 'productName-a' vs 'productName-ov').
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Vlasnik {{productName}}-ov je uspešno promenjen. Bićete preusmereni za 10 sekundi.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: Leading space before '{{productName}}' in the Chinese translation.
